nodes.bodyText:
add test cases with:

NULL
''
different length
non-digits
non-ascii, like ą
non-BMP, like 🚀 (utf-16 surrogate pairs)

nodes.bodyText:
String#substring is expensive.
But you do not need String at all.
See below for exaple how to proces Slice varchar character-by-character:
https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/6d9d47e0909b3fe9367584ba8450827dbbb8e1d7/presto-main/src/main/java/io/prestosql/type/LikeFunctions.java#L134
We can process the bytes of the slice. If they aren't in the range of ASCII digits, then the function throws. This handles any non-ASCII or non-BMP automatically.

Changed this to "int n = getCodePointAt(slice, i) - 48;"
And added a catch for InvalidUtf8Exception.
I think n *= 2 would be better from a readability perspective, since we're not explicitly doing bit manipulation here. The JIT will optimize this to a shift.

According to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luhn_algorithm the algorithm is used for more than just credit cards. I think we should also fail (rather than return false) on any non-digit input.
How about this for the description

Checks that a string of digits is valid according to the Luhn algorithm
This shouldn't be needed since we aren't decoding UTF-8
I don't believe so - i think expected behavior would be to return false for the empty string.
Capitalize Luhn since it's a name
